A confidential and data-secure platform would empower survivors to report abuse safely and get matched to nearby legal, medical, and counseling services. Potential measurable impacts:

  1. 30% increase in reported cases (improved reporting confidence)
  2. Reduced case processing time by 50% through automated workflows
  3. Data insights to guide NGO and government interventions
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.problem_statement: Gender-based violence and harassment are severely underreported in Nigeria due to stigma, lack of trust in authorities, and fear of retaliation. Survivors often have no safe or anonymous channel to report incidents or access support services.
x_snc_hack4good_0_hack4good_proposal.solution_proposal:
How do you envision the ideal solution to this  problem?

 

Which ServiceNow products or capabilities would be used?

  1. ServiceNow Case Management for secure and confidential reporting
  2. Virtual Agent for automated guidance and anonymity
  3. Integration Hub for connecting to local helplines and NGOs

 

Are there any technical dependencies for the proposed solution?

  1. Multi-language SMS/chatbot integration (English, Hausa, Yoruba, Igbo)
  2. Secure cloud hosting compliant with data protection standards

 

What challenges would you foresee in implementing this idea?

  1. Building trust in digital reporting systems
  2. Ensuring anonymity and data privacy
  3. Coordinating multiple stakeholders (police, NGOs, medical units)
